Dear Margaret Dunn:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
01/15/2025. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result in
compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the corrective
action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be completed
or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.

180-days whichever is less, and a written evaluation of the employee’s
performance annually thereafter.

The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Consultation was provided regarding completing restraint reports and entering
them in MISACWIS timely.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during this
period under review.
Financial Overview
There are no financial concerns based on the facility’s budget and financial audit.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
Not Applicable
Chief Administrator Assessment
Chief Administrator Assessment was completed on time and was comprehensive
and reviewed the areas of noncompliance. The agency will now complete quarterly
internal audits to monitor the human resources department. No citations from this
renewal inspection were cited as repeat citations.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff reported feeling supported by supervisors, and upper management. They said
the facility’s main goal is ensuring the safety and well-being of the youths and the
administration strives at ensuring all the youths needs are being met. Staff
indicated they receive ample training that has been very beneficial in assisting them
in caring for all the youths.
4

Youths interviewed reported all their needs are being met and expressed no
concerns regarding staff or the facility.
Description of Agency Walk Through
An on-site inspection and walkthrough of the facility occurred on 01/15/2025.
completed and the facility was found to be clean, neat, and appropriate. Bedrooms
had clean sheets, pillows, and comforters. Kitchen was observed to have menus
posted, plenty of food, and very clean.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
